com.ashwin.compress

Class Chunker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ashwin.compress.Chunker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModifiedChunker, StandardChunker

    public abstract class Chunker
extends java.lang.Object
    Chunkers are responsible for transforming binary bits to and from integers. Different chunkers have different methods of performing the translation to and from binary.
    Author:
    ashwin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Chunker(int chunkSize)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract int[] chunk(boolean[] bits)
      Chunks an array of input bits into integer values.
      int getChunkSize()
      The chunk size represents the number of bits in integers generated by this chunker.
      boolean[] unchunk(int value)
      Unchunks an integer into bits.
      abstract boolean[] unchunk(int[] chunks)
      Unchunks an array of chunked integers into bits.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chunker

        public Chunker(int chunkSize)

    • Method Detail

      • getChunkSize

        public int getChunkSize()
        The chunk size represents the number of bits in integers generated by this chunker. Therefore, the chunk size must be a positive integer greater than 0 and less than or equal to 32 (size of an integer on most architectures).
        Returns:

      • chunk

        public abstract int[] chunk(boolean[] bits)
        Chunks an array of input bits into integer values.
        Parameters:
        bits -
        Returns:

      • unchunk

        public abstract boolean[] unchunk(int[] chunks)
        Unchunks an array of chunked integers into bits.
        Parameters:
        chunks -
        Returns:

      • unchunk

        public final boolean[] unchunk(int value)
        Unchunks an integer into bits. The returned array of bits will have size equal to chunkSize. The bits are returned from most significant to least significant.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
